content: The aging process for a perfume formula can vary depending on the specific ingredients used, but generally, it is recommended to age perfume blends for a minimum of 4-6 weeks. This allows time for the different notes to meld and develop into a harmonious blend. However, some perfumers may prefer to age their blends for longer periods, up to several months or even years, to achieve a desired effect. It's always a good idea to test and evaluate the perfume at different stages of the aging process to determine the optimal aging time for a particular formula.
